description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: The subscription resource is used to define a push based subscription from a server to another system. Once a subscription is registered with the server, the server checks every resource that is created or updated, and if the resource matches the given criteria, it sends a message on the defined "channel" so that another system is able to take an appropriate action.

status.description: The status of the subscription, which marks the server state for managing the subscription.

contact.description: Contact details for a human to contact about the subscription. The primary use of this for system administrator troubleshooting.

end.description: The time for the server to turn the subscription off.

reason.description: A description of why this subscription is defined.

criteria.description: The rules that the server should use to determine when to generate notifications for this subscription.

error.description: A record of the last error that occurred when the server processed a notification.

channel.description: Details where to send notifications when resources are received that meet the criteria.

tag.description: A tag to add to any resource that matches the criteria, after the subscription is processed.

allOf.description: The subscription resource is used to define a push based subscription from a server to another system. Once a subscription is registered with the server, the server checks every resource that is created or updated, and if the resource matches the given criteria, it sends a message on the defined "channel" so that another system is able to take an appropriate action.

type.description: The type of channel to send notifications on.

endpoint.description: The uri that describes the actual end-point to send messages to.

payload.description: The mime type to send the payload in - either application/fhir+xml, or application/fhir+json. If the payload is not present, then there is no payload in the notification, just a notification.

header.description: Additional headers / information to send as part of the notification.
